Christine.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants.

private_information: Preference: would rather not meet on Monday after 13:00
Janice.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants respecting my preference if possible.

Bobby.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants.

Elizabeth.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants.

Tyler.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants.

Edward.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 for all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participant availability and preferences to produce a consolidated 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for everyone.

public_information: Meeting required for participants Christine Janice Bobby Elizabeth Tyler Edward
Meeting must be scheduled on Monday
There exists a solution that works with everyone's schedule

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Christine. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->Christine->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->Christine->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to model your availability and constraints for the meeting. Target the FastDownward PDDL solver. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and name them to reflect the agent.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are six participant agents planning to schedule a meeting. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to integrate them to solve the orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind the PDDL they send may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may require integrating additional information from other PDDL outputs to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear as different names for the same time slot or resource. Here is the PDDL response from Christine: {pddl_christine} Here is the PDDL response from Janice: {pddl_janice} Here is the PDDL response from Bobby: {pddl_bobby} Here is the PDDL response from Elizabeth: {pddl_elizabeth} Here is the PDDL response from Tyler: {pddl_tyler} Here is the PDDL response from Edward: {pddl_edward} Integrate these responses, keep actions of each agent distinct, and produce a consolidated PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that finds a 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants. Target the FastDownward PDDL solver. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
